Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that receives plenty of water and light, showing it is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough water, showing it is wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough light, showing it is weak or not growing well.
The student can include in the drawing a comparison between plants with water and light and those without, highlighting differences.
The student can show, through their drawing, that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit or incorrectly label some elements, like forgetting to indicate where the light is coming from or mislabeling parts of the plant (e.g., label leaves as 'roots')
The student might show minor inconsistencies in depicting the severity of the plants' conditions (e.g., a wilting plant might appear slightly healthier than intended).
